Honestly, she wasn't bad at all. I would recommend if you like working at your pace. Just that there are lectures and reading, but I never read anything until the quizzes and lectures have questions. not a tough grader.

Very unforgiving professor, the workload is terrible for a 3 credit class. The movies, lectures, and material are insanely dry and boring. Every week there are 3 lectures that are way too long and her commentary contributes to nothing. She loves to hear herself talk. She is also a very rude professor and has no sense of mercy if a student messes up

Normal amount of work for an asynchronous course, but the group projects are absolute nightmares. I had trouble communicating with my group so I reached out for help/guidance. Instead of replying back to me personally, she "solved" it by emailing the entire group with a threat to take points from all of us if she heard of anymore issues from us.

Too much work for a 3 credit class that most people take just to fulfill a GE. There was 3 lectures of about 30 minutes each every week, and she expected us to watch 3 hour long Bollywood movies to participate in the questions. Her directions for the group projects were unclear and instead of clarifying, she was just passive in the grading.

Dr. Nagar was great! There were 3 weekly online lectures (10-20 mins) with 1-2 questions to answer in them. There were a few quizzes, all extended response. Then two group projects. Pretty stress-free and not crazy difficult. She does give a lot of material at once on top of a weekly movie which was annoying, but the assignments-a breeze.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU THINK ITS GONNA BE A CAKEWALK.

This is too much work for a 3 credit class. First, you are given five lectures, each 30-50 minutes long, and have free responses for each of them. Always go for the word count maximum because they take points off for not being engaging. Projects are time-consuming and just overall too much work! Find another GE because this took up a lot of time.
It's spring break and I'm doing some crack group project because of her. Enough said.

She sucks. I thought the class would be fun and an easy A but I literally have more assignments from this boring class than from my major core classes. For some reason she's stuck in the 70s because all the movies you're supposed to watch (1-2 a WEEK) are from then. Wiki summaries>>
Also her accent is annoying and fake (I say this as an Indian)

Took SASIA 2220 and she was great overall. You have unlimited time for the quizzes and tests from the time they open till they close, so you can exit out and resume whenever. Didn't watch any lecture videos or do readings until the quizzes and exams and always got a 100%.

She seems like a nice lady but the workload is horrible. The movies were hours long and the lectures were about average but along with movies and readings it was a lot of work to go through. If you are looking for something easier than this is NOT the class for you. again shes nice but the workload is horrible and I wouldnt reccomend.

It is the middle of the semster and this class is too much. The amount of readings and lectures shes posts along with movies is way too much. Last week we had a 2hr and 30 min movie along with readies and 3 lecture videos. She is doing way too much for GE and honestly if you want an easy A this would not be the class for you. I regret taking her
Such a nice professor. So passionate about Bollywood films and what she does! Amazing professor, probably my favourite this semester.

It's a super boring class with super dry content, really horrible, poor quality, it's painful for me to do the homework and especially painful for the quiz and the final exam. For the final exam, you need to write 500 words for each one. If you are looking for an easy A, take the theater class.

This is an easy A class however I have two complaints. The material we covered, in my opinion, was not interesting nor engaging. Secondly, the final has 5 questions to which the answers to have to at least be 500 words. This is unreasonable because the answers would be about 300 or less words.

I love Ila she is so sweet. I took her online for the history of South Asia and I honestly learned a lot. The quizzes are very simple and you get unlimited time to do them. Interesting assignments that are actually interesting to do. Easy grader and a really sweet woman overall.

This class is fun and enjoyable! You just have to watch the lecture videos, take notes, and then summarize your notes each week for the short responses. I'll be honest, I didn't watch any of the films, just read the Wikipedia plot summary, and I got all 10/10s. The movie clips I did watch were fun, and I learned a ton about Bollywood. Easy A!

I felt that a lot of lectures were unclear and that she wasn't very accessible or interested in helping students, and most of the assignments were just regurgitation. However, because of that, this class is a super easy A so I can't really complain much about it, but I felt like I didn't learn much actual useful information.

Ila Nagar is the BEST professor at the Ohio State University. I am taking her course online. All you have to do is listen to weekly lecture and watch weekly Indian movie and write a reflection based on certain week. You will have to make one podcast on a movie. If you want A take in Culture and Diversity take this course. I love this professor.
Great professor.

The class material is fun and easy, but it seemed incredibly easy to get away with not watching the movies, not watching the lectures, and not doing the reading because the class was online. I personally did most of the aforementioned and found the class to be easy and entertaining. She's a good professor who really cares and the class is easy.

Ila taught me so much about life in South Asia. She incorporated multiple countries and social groups and aspects of the culture, and while there was a lot of reading it was manageable and interesting, interspersed with other media like films. She also gave generous extra credit opportunities! Ila is great!
She is amazing--completely hilarious personality. As long as you stay on her good side and do not abuse the times she lets you skip, you will be fine
Awesome, if you want to learn a language but dont know which one, take hindi, you will learn a lot and she is absolutely awesome!
Excellent!

Great professor for Italian 1101. There is a good amount of online homework but that is to be expected for a 4 hour course where 1 hour of that is to be completed online asynchronously. Very nice person and very funny, you really can't ask for a better professor as a beginner in the language. Do the work, attend class, and you'll be perfectly fine.

She is the nicest teacher I have ever had and she truly cares about the success of her students. It is a lot of group discussions, a couple easy papers, and one long paper instead of an exam. She offers extra credit if you are in need and is a pretty easy grader.

The sweetest woman! She is very caring and passionate about what she does. As long as you put effort in and are respectful, you will do just fine! :) She responds quickly to emails and loves to hear about your day!

Laura is so caring and understanding to all her students. One of the sweetest professors! Attendance is worth a small portion of your grade, but she mainly cares about you just putting the effort in for her class.

Might be one of the only professors who genuinely wants all their students to do well in their class. She's lenient on deadlines so please take advantage of any opportunities she gives you. She doesn't grade harshly and is overall a "student's teacher". Not to mention she's the kindest person ever.
Ms. Angelica was a fun professor. She is very accomodating and personable both in lectures and office hours.

Took her when she was a graduate student. Clear expectations; straightforward and easy intro class. High participation and completion emphasis. Lectures can be dry at times, but never too heavy in material. Seems like she's still finding her grove in teaching, I hope to see her confidence and passion grow as the years go by.

Jingyi was a good instructor. I didn't participate much in lectures and mostly did homework, but the most important part was the practice problems at the end of each lectures. They would be very similar to the ones on exams. She is an easy grader as well and approachable for questions.
A good resource for students. She was very informative during lectures and gave us ample opportunity for practice. It was a pleasure taking this class!

Professor Chens class was very good. We studied lots of intro linguistics topics; for each, we had 1 homework assignment plus 1 mini-paper about a textbook chapter. She always answered e-mails fast, and graded most assignments within hours/days. Some subjects were a little confusing, but she did her best to explain them clearly. Recommended!

My top notes are that LING 2001 with Emily doesn't have that many assignments outside of exercises, so doing well in the heavier weighted assignments is crucial. Expect this class to be more mathematics-like in its theory and approach. Problem sets are key. Smaller class, ask questions. Emily is always willing to explain and guide you.

Amazing teacher and so funny. Makes everything relate to the subject matter. Easy but only if you go to class. Remembers everyone's name and if you ask for help will put in so much effort to help you understand the material. Stayed with students all night and even will take calls over the phone to walk students through problems. I recommend him!

super easy class if you understand even the slightest bit of math. super clear professor funny too. made a legit effort to learn peoples names and make class fun. No textbook which is nice on my wallet too

Chris was awesome. He made a really boring class interesting. Make sure you go to class or you will be absolutely lost. No tests just problem sets worth 200 points a piece (600 points of the 1000 point class). These are graded for correctness. And you MUST go to class in order to do well on them. He's awesome though and VERY helpful.
he saved my life!!!
Fun GEC. He made it really interesting. He is really helpful and funny.

Terrible professor.. do not recommend. Not helpful at all, teaches course curriculum incorrectly and then when students get questions wrong on the exams by answering the questions how he taught them he will respond that you should have known he was wrong through textbook readings. There is only two exams, a midterm and a final with homework often.

Morton is great!The class itself is quite easy to do well in if you have some experience with linguistics (and the first 2-3 weeks will be a tad boring, but stick it out and it gets fascinating), but she's very helpful and understanding towards students wo prior linguistics study. She's very engaging and her lecturesgrasp of the subject is ace.

She seems really into it.  Sometimes she's weird about grading and doesn't give the impression that she's super knowledgeable.  The class was hard if you haven't taken linguistics before and easy if you have, and she is definitely incredibly helpful.  Textbook only helpful as a reference.

Dr. Morton is by far the most helpful teacher I've come across. I took an upper level linguistics course with no knowledge of this subject at all, so it definitely took a lot to get used to it. She was amazing at helping and even met outside her office hours for help. Don't have to read, get a cheat sheet for midterms, and have a take home final.

There is a lot of reading for every class meeting. You must post on a discussion board before every meeting, so the reading is mandatory. The lectures were very confusing, lots of abstract modeling that he doesn't even test you on. He's very direct about tests, so you can still do well in the course and not completely understand every concept.

Assigned a lot of reading, but most if it was easy and interesting; asked that you comment on what you read for participation grade. It seems like he was thrown off this semester by the format of the book changing and made the lectures really language model-heavy instead of concepts. I suspect it'll be balanced better next time.

Professor Schuler is well prepared for class, knowledgeable, funny, patient, helpful and humble. It is obvious that he wants students to succeed, and I would definitely recommend him to anyone. I can personally attest to his patience: there was a student that would always interrupt in class and he didn't want to strangle him!
Speaks quickly and online slides are not the most clear.  Reading the book is essential and the exams are fair but very detailed.
Really straightforward and to the point instructor. She tells you exactly what's on the exams and quizzes, and how to study
Online class but required to attend required dates and times.

You won't learn a single thing, but it is an easy A for people who need GE data analysis credit. Also, make sure to schedule office hours if you need to talk to her; I showed up several times during her scheduled office hours, and she wasn't there.
Amanda is a great teacher because she is more than willing to help you if you don't understand the work. She was very helpful and I definitely recommend her.

This is my 2nd class with her, hence a 2nd review. As disorganized as she is, Phonology (LING 4300) was EASY.. 30% of the grade was for in-class assignments, all for completion... easy to get an A even if you don't understand anything... no exams.. grades easy.. irritating lectures, just easy A and a core requirement completion... no exams. EASY!

Professor Miller was extremely disorganized both in thought and in her curriculum. She often confused the class by blatantly switching terms around. After probably week 1 or 2 the syllabus schedule went out the window. We skipped quizzes and assignments left and right. We had to retake a quiz because there were errors in most of her questions.
Do not take this class.  Just don't do it.  Save yourself some time and effort.

Nice lady, but she was very disorganized and absent minded. I don't think I learned a single thing in this class. Most assignments were just copy pasting code into this program (which you've never heard of and will never use again) without knowing what's going on. Spent a whole day once going over the differences between "and" and "or". Not fun.

Amanda seems to be a very nice and helpful person. However her class and office are so disorganized that she always has to extend due dates. There was no grading rubric for anything which is why she lets you revise assignments for extra points. Grades are posted in the last minute. Extremely extremely disorganized. Lost some of my assignments.

Professor Miller is one of the nicest professors you will ever come across! Of course those of you who took her for 286 or 201 did not enjoy it, because her focus is in phonetics. Her labs are pretty simple, and she doesn't care for 'fluff', just do the work, and show her you care, and you will walk out with an A. :) highly recommend

This was a horrible class. I only stayed in it because there are no exams, and it only meets twice a week. She has no idea how to use the program, and expects us to understand how to use it. She is willing to help if you ask, and she seems to be a nice person. She is just a horrible teacher. Definitely do not recommend.

This is a data analysis class and not only does Dr. Miller not really seem to know how the program works, but she also keeps putting incorrect instructions on Carmen. She frequently puts drop boxes up only a few hours before an item is due. Her saving grace though is if you were completely confused, she will help you ASAP. Not the worst professor.

Dr. Miller isn't the clearest in lecture, but she is there to help students during office hours if needed.  Most of the material presented in lecture isn't particularly helpful but lecture slides are posted to Carmen for later review.  Do the labs (they're pretty quick and easy), and skim your book and notes before quizzes and you'll do fine.

Easiest class I've ever taken in my life. I got an A without learning anything and spending a total of 4 hours the entire quarter on homework. The exams are take-home and straight out of the book. The 2 hour lectures were periods of trying my patience. I recommend it as a GPA booster. Do not recommend it as something fun or interesting.

When I started this class, I thought I would hate it.  I'm not interested in linguistics and she seemed disorganized.  After a few weeks, though, I started to love P. Miller.  She's incredibly nice and incredibly smart, in addition to an easy grader.  Some of my friends hate the course material, but we all like her. Give the class a shot!

She's tied for the worst professor I've ever had. She makes you play vowel bingo in class, but everyone has the same board, so you all win at the same time and there's no point. And she gives instructions like "highlight an inch or so," and then expect answers accurate within 10 Hz with those ambiguous directions. I definitely do NOT recommend her.

3 of his classes over the years, and my experience has been consistent: -Lot of reading outside of class -Group work in class (occasional lecture) -Tough grader (but extra credit!) Brilliant and respected linguist, kind guy. Biggest mistake students make is not asking questions when confused. He is very willing and wants to help students succeed.

Never read, left with an A. Tons of extra credits. Easy af. I've taken many 5000 leveled ones and this is among the easiest. As a teacher, Peter is smart and clear while delivering lectuers. I attended every session because they are fun!

Make no mistake, Peter is tough, but he's also one of the most brilliant geniuses I've ever met. Getting on his good side is not hard: show an interest in the subject and make an honest effort. Be warned, he does grade hard. Peter sometimes can be the "daft professor" stereotype but you'll never have a class period with him where you don't laugh.

Although I know some students had rather negative views towards Dr. Culicover, I personally loved him! Syntax can be a rather dry course, yet I think Dr. Culicover did an excellent job of making the classes interesting even for those who aren't huge fans of syntax. I loved his sense of humor, and he was genuinely super helpful and excited to teach.
Great guy, very knowledgable and passionate about syntax, but the class seemed to be incredibly disorganized. Assigned reading was all online, but it was very hard to understand.

Extremely hard class, probably the hardest linguistics class you will ever take. But Culicover really isn't a terrible professor at all. He tends to assume that students have prior knowledge of the subject, so he doesn't really teach at an introductory level. Once you actually understand the subject matter, it's very interesting. Read the textbook!

This was by far the worst taught class I have ever taken in all of my years in higher education. The teacher was unclear, his 'notes' were impossible to follow and f he obviously didn't get it he would pick on you specifically. He had no grading scale and once admitted he graded my test too harshly because he felt like it. Avoid ad all costs.

He tried to be helpful and clear, he really did.  He obviously loves teaching undergrads, and he's always excited if you ask questions, but pretty frequently he gives vague answers and goes on tangents.  The assignments aren't hard if you read the book, but if you don't understand something right away you probably never will.

He makes you work for the knowledge rather than spoon-feeding it to you, but he never makes you feel like an idiot for not understanding. He is clearly more concerned about making sure students understand the material than anything else and does his best to help. Do expect to put in a lot of study time, though.  Overall a fantastic professor.

I have never pulled as many all nighters as I have for this class, but it was worth it! I learned more with Professor Culicover in 5 weeks than any other class at OSU. Tip: ALWAYS do the extra credit, he will give you points for TRYING.. it really does add up. He is absolutely brilliant, and kind. Take his class if you want to really learn syntax.

Dr. Culicover is an absolutely brilliant researcher, but an incredibly difficult professor. His quizzes, while generally loaded with extra credit, are incredibly complex and vary greatly from in class examples and homework. When you go to his office hours, he refers you to the book (he wrote) or produces a long academic article to answer your ?

It's the subject matter that's confusing, not him. He tries his best to help us understand. Very nice, friendly, and helpful. However, there's a bit of a disconnect between in-class material and assignments/exams. Grading is very strange. It's hard to keep track of what's important to know and what's not.

The subject matter is difficult, and he does tend to move very quickly, but if you stop and ask him a question, he'll answer it (or, rather, work with you until you can find the answer yourself).  Great teacher, clearly ridiculously intelligent.
He's an amazing teacher who is willing to work to help you to understand the difficult subject he teaches.

Culicover constantly went on tangents not relating to syntax whatsoever. His lectures are dull and long, asking for questions to be answered later on in class. He also makes you buy his $60 book, which is filled with errors, and then posts an errata on Carmen, expecting you to fill in the holes throughout the semester.  Not helpful in office hours

Peter is one of the greatest professors I have had at Ohio State. Id recommend him to anyone. He's absolutely brilliant and anyone who takes his class is lucky to get the opportunity to have him as a teacher

Great professor. He had a lot of fun teaching the course and the lectures dragged on sometimes like they all do but you have to read and then come to class lecture. Also, try really hard on the homework even though its not graded because the quiz questions are very similar. Had a hard time learning the material but he offers a discussion class too.

Wrote the book and clings to it.  He gives you homework before he teaches the material, then expects you to pick up the material after he explains the homework and you never see it again until the test.  Worst class structuring I've seen at OSU.  Will avoid at all costs for the rest of my college career.

Basically one of the best professors you can have. If you're going to a class to memorize and take every note, you're in the wrong class. If you want to actually learn something, this is the place to be.
Terrible. He wrote the textbook so if you don't unerstand his wording there...don't bother asking him. You'll get the same explanation that book gives. Completely useless information.

Peter is helpful if you go to him and state your case.  Quite neurotic, but clearly a star in his field.  His class will really make you think outside the box.  Because of Peter's class I now believe my major is the best and most difficult at OSU.
Acts like he knows his stuff, but he really doesn't. Not a pleasant class to take.

Really unhelpful guy... the class is poorly structured and he picks on people that he KNOWS are confused.  I'd recommend taking syntax with another prof; I'm sure it would be worth avoiding Culicover.

This guy is the department chair, and it is obvious he couldn't be bothered with teaching. His organization is dismal (starts the class with one topic and then just "sees where it goes", etc.), and his expectations are sky-high.  If you try to work with him during his office hours, he comes off as busy and irritated. Brilliant guy, awful teacher.

as a person, i really like him, but once he starts teaching, i can't stand him. the material can be confusing as it is, but his teaching style is unclear and pretty sporadic. really hard to take notes or follow his outlines... also pretty discouraging, makes one not want to talk out loud in class.

Very nice guy and easy to talk to, but as a teacher he's poor.Plays favorites and expects BS in the form of comments and questions every 5 minutes, not exactly an atmosphere conducive to note-taking, etc.
No Comments
Great Prof.
my favorite prof, hands down.
Pretty fun teacher. Always kept our discussions based in reality, encouraged personal explorations of the subjects.
No Comments

He is a truly amazing Professor.  If you have the opportunity to take his class, DO NOT HESITATE.  He is one of the best Professors at Ohio State.  He keeps his classes very interesting and he is HIGHLY knowledgeable in the field of Linguistics.  Additionally, he a very friendly and approachable.

Rachel is a really nice woman, but a terrible teacher.  She made it so hard to pay attention in class because she was so boring and I barely got through the class with an A. Studying the worksheets she hands out in class really helps with the midterm and final though. If possible, I would avoid having her all together.

Never seemed to be able to get her point across, she rambled on and on about things that were irrelevant to the class. You end up having to teach yourself all the material on your own because her teaching is terrible. You can get better quality at CSCC and any other professor at OSU

Recycled old rubrics w/ old due dates. Never answered emails personally, always had to go ask in person again. Very flexible with deadlines b/c of May Session. Quizzes were free-writes about reading the night before. So busy w/ her own life, class seemed thrown together. Couldn't finish grading on time and deleted 5 days' worth of quiz pts (10).

Good lecturer, interesting and really connects with students. Grading was fair, although he rarely gave feedback and graded some assignments literally 2mo after submission. Quizzes over readings, but book was readable and only $10. Final was an extended group project that takes way too much of your time. Overall good class, but wouldn't take again.

Alex was great.  He is fairly new so sometimes he doesn't have a clear train of thought with his lectures but 90% of the time he is able to clarify the issue by the end of the class.  He's super helpful and very understanding.  Quizzes are super easy because he lets you bring a cheat sheet in

I absolutely adore working with Judith and her classes have always been a delight. Her explanations of semantic concepts are clear, and she helps students come to their own conclusions about many topics. She's always very up-front about her expectations and if you put in the effort, you'll go far in her courses.

I also did not like her. She can't teach, and contradicts herself all the time. In addition, shows no interest in teaching. When you ask her a question she sends you off to the T.A., which is the reason in the first place why I had come to Judith, cause the T.A. is horrible at explaining. Anyways, she's one of the worst teachers i had at OSU.

She was the type of professor who kept the quantity of work to an easily manageable level, but we still learned a ton.  Her style was fairly easy-going, and the class atmosphere always spawned good discussion.

Amazing professor. Judith is one of-if not the best- professor I've ever had. She made syntax very very easy. I tried to take this class with Dr. Levine and it was impossible. Make sure you get Judith any chance you get. There are almost weekly assignments, graded on content but effort goes a long way. Tests are completely open book.

Professor Campbell-Kibler is great; very knowledgable and passionate about what she teaches. She does the research work and field involvement to back up her teaching and I respect how she incorporates her own work so well. The class is very complex and confusing for a GE, but she is very accessible/easy to meet with which helps.

She seems like a very nice, knowledgable person. However, she grades all writing assignments really hard and gives a lot of work, especially for this class being a gen Ed. The class also wasn't very organized. Even though the subject matter of this class is interesting, if you need structure and don't have a lot of extra time, don't take it.

I loved this class! It is very interesting, and worth your time.  She doesn't use a textbook, instead she gathers a lot of different articles to read.  I felt like her class was easy, and she is very passionate about what she teaches.
Not a lot of work but very confusing coursework. Only one paper all quarter but she grades it really hard
Class analyzes the validity of arguments using math-like formulas. Kind of confusing and pointless, but it counts as a math GEC. Scott is very nice.
Definitely the most difficult class I took this quarter. If you are not into very complicated, math-like concepts, think very hard before taking this class.

Craige is a fantastic teacher and is the reason why i'm considering linguistics as a major. She can be rude at times and comes off as hard to talk to, but she's genuinely interested in the subject material and teaching it. She came late to a large amount of classes, but it was always worth it to stay and wait for her.

For a 62-year-old woman, she's extremely sharp. Too bad she is also aware of it and can come across as haughty and mightier-than-thou as a result. Doesn't seem to care about class to much and is regularly late/absent. She hates you for thinking this is an easy-A class, though it is. Also apparently a believer of intelligent design.

Very interesting class. Dr. Roberts is genuinely interested in teaching the subject and it shows. Class is mostly interacting with students and not basic note-taking. One test on the phonetic alphabet, short final paper, and weekly homework for completion grade. Easy class and you learn a lot. Highly recommend Dr. Roberts.
I've learned more in one quarter from this woman than I did in four years of high school, and she's really easy to talk to.
Craige's class is the reason I picked linguistics as my major
she was very nice what she talks about in class is exactly what comes up. very very straightforward a fun class especially if you enjoy the material

Michelle was a fantastic TA. When she was allowed to teach the class, she made everything clear and interesting. Her linguistic background in Tagalog helped to make her create relevant connections to her own language.

Michelle is excellent! She gives real world examples to relate to her students (i.e. Lady GaGa videos,etc).  She goes over exactly what she expects of you on homework/exams.  Attendance isn't mandatory but I went to every class because she's so fun! You don't need the textbook at all, she goes over everything in her slides she posts on CARMEN.

I was excited about this class but it was THE most boring class ever. I struggled to stay awake and Lia often went off topic. She made the topic of linguistics very confusing and it was very difficult for me to write my 10 page final paper.

I was so excited for this class.  Then it killed the topic of advertising for me.  The only interesting part was the assignments.  The 4 hours of lecture every week were the biggest waste of time.  I can honestly say learn anything from Lia's class other than how to find advertisements on youtube

I love linguistics, but this class was a pain. Daily hw assignments like we were in HS and she took a long time grading the problem sets. We spent a lot of time in class discussions, which is normally fine, but these discussions went nowhere.
No Comments

Ms. Mansfield teaches Lingiustics, a subject which could possibly be why half the class is totally lost/confused. But it might also be because Ms. Mansfield is very eccentric in her teaching and often goes off on tangents without properly explaining the ideas.

Professor Mansfield is extremely enthusiastic about her subject.  She could make anyone love linguistics!  I would recommend her class to anyone with an interest in the subject, or who happens to need gen. ed. cred.  Thanks for a great class, Professor Mansfield!
No midterm or final, but she does give assignments that are ridiculously close to busy work (summarizing a chapter, etc). Means well but isn't always totally clear.

She means well, but is not very helpful. One small project each week, sometimes took hours and hours to do and she grades them tough.  She's unclear in her teaching, and seems like she doesn't really know what she's teaching, as she is easily persuaded away from her points by any student comments. No Midterm or final is a plus.
The subject matter is exremely interesting but he can be annoying. so overall liked the class but didnt like him.

Save your time and money!Class is boring and you will fall asleep. Professor is unorganized as was stated by students above. Material presented is coming from books, nothing new from her. She does not respond to e-mails ever. As well what was the most irritating is that professor liked to go overtime like 3-5 minutes, asking same questions.

Dr. Rose's class was very difficult for me. I tried hard to understand the notes and homework but it didn't seem to work. I asked her for help which did help a little but not enough for me to fully understand linguistics. The first secions we covered were the most difficult. The best thing was the take home midterm. I agree she was unorganized.

Dr. Rose was a pretty good teacher; sometimes she was a little confusing but if you tell her you are confused she can always find a way to explain. She is very unorganized, which can be good and bad: due dates get pushed back, but you don't always get grades or papers back. Just attend class and participate and you'll be fine!

A very interesting professor. Down to earth and funny too. Sometimes she can seem intimidating, but I feel like it's just because she knows you can do better and she tries to get you to. Always willing to clarify if you're not sure on something, like your data analysis projects. Definitely a solid choice for a professor.

Down-to-earth, very humorous and fun prof. Attendance is mandatory, but you will want to go to class if you're going in with an interest in introductory linguistics. Offers tons of extra credit. There is some work outside of class time (avg 2 hours total over 2 sessions) to fulfill LOC requirement.  Do everything you can to get Dr. Smith!
Bridget is intimidating the first week in order to weed out people who don't want to work hard. If you put in an effort, you'll be fine. Our class average was a 99%, she's all about the bonus points.

The person who advised against "Ms. Smith" is entirely wrong. Bridget is an awesome teacher. She was there for her students when they needed her and she presented the information  clearly and in a fun way. If you are thinking of taking this class I highly suggest you DO so. It's awesome. She does swear in class. If you can't handle that, grow up!

Bridget is a great teacher. She did her best to make the classes fun/applicable and was always there to take time if you didn't understand. Using the program "R" is annoying and using computer code was hard, but the class was overall pretty easy. and no tests!

Bridget was awesome. This class wasn't the easiest one I've taken, but its the only one I could actually pay attention in because she always made it fun. I loved that she could teach us so much while still making class enjoyable. I would most definitely take another class with her if I could!

Although this class was not easy I thoroughly enjoyed it! Bridget is funny and is always willing to help you. Her vulgar language she warned us about on the first day of class. It was a relief to not have some stuck up teacher thinking she is better than you because she is getting her PhD! The only complaint I have is the room and the no windows bu

This class was tough but Bridget is there every single day to help.  She has an extreme interest and understanding for the material and is excited about what she does.  I struggled through every single assignment but because I went to class, paid attention and did my work I came out with a good grade.  She is an outstanding professor!

This class was an easy A. I suggest taking the class with a friend or two so you can split the work load. A decent amount of work, but NO EXAMS! Bridget is a Cool person and let us joke around a bunch in class which was a nice relief profs who take stuff too seriously. Didn't learn much, but I got my A, which is really all I wanted out of the class

This class was a lot of fun!  It was a little challenging at times, but the teacher was very helpful!  In response to the person who commented below, Bridget Smith gave fair warning at the beginning of the quarter about her use language, so there's no room to complain.  If you can't handle stuff like that, then you SHOULD DROP THE CLASS!

Class was a piece of cake. We were pretty much spoon fed what we needed to know and not required to retain anything afterwards. Plus she offers many chances for extra credit. I was hoping to actually learn something from this class but I didn't. Oh well, I won't complain too much because it was an easy A.
Such an excellent teacher and person! She was very helpful and she cares and looks after her students!
She was very bouncy!  This was my first linguistics class and I'm now in 201, and I really appreciate the time she took with me. she really helped me over and above the call of duty.

Absolutely amazing teacher. One of the best I've had at Ohio State. She makes class way more entertaining than it needs to be. She cusses and it's hilarious. When everyone bombed the midterm, she gave us a ton of extra credit. I believe she actually said, "So everyone is probably going to get an A, and I don't care."
Abby Walker is a genuinely good professor. She is a tough grader, but her adorable new zealand accent makes it worthwhile

Abby is wonderful! If you can take a class taught by her you must take it! She is perfect! She will do what ever it takes to make students understand. There is no text book, and you just have to do readings on carmen. There are no exams just little weekly quizzes and a few papers. Easy class and she has an awesome accent.

Totally loved her as an instructor. She made class a lot of fun and kept the discussions interesting. The left a LOT of feedback on our writing assignments and it was so helpful. Great person to have teach the class! :)

A ridiculously hard grader! In my third year at OSU and this class requires the most work out of any of the classes I've taken thus far. Takes the time to write extremely critical comments on papers, but is hypocritical; her (infrequent) powerpoints and class notes are riddled with typos. Confusing, challenging, and ineffectual teaching methods.

Nice person, but she grades VERY HARD! She assigns readings that are mind-numbing and makes you do a lot of work. She is very knowledgeable on linguistics, but the class is not at all interesting, at least to a non-linguistics major. I wish I would have never taken this class.

I couldn't decide for the longest time if I liked Christin as a person. As a teacher, she's one of the most legit I've ever had. She actually gets stuff back to you REALLY quickly. Tons of comments. Really useful, really helpful. She gives points wherever she can. Lots of reading, in addition to a decent workload. Keep up and you'll be fine.

The most boring class I have ever taken with the most boring professor I have had probably ever. The material itself was useless and on top of that the professor has an attitude when you get things wrong. Save yourself the trouble and just take a real math class instead. Its just not worth it.

Extremely boring, I never fall asleep during classes but this was an exception. He also has an attitude when you make a mistake like "you should have known that can't you read it's right there" instead of explaining why something is wrong. lastly the class material itself is utterly useless. your better of sucking it up and taking a real math class
I had Mr. D for the Dialects of Ohio class. Very interesting--you can def tell he knows the research. Very interesting class.
my review above should say "aren't doing busy work"
Easy grader. Like others have said, a lot of readers for the class, but we also discussed just about all of them, so at least you feel like you are doing busy work.
Dr. Durian is a really cool guy. Very laid back, easy grader, and makes class interesting. I would definitely recommend him!

Mr. Durian was really nice and funny. He was a softy when it came to grading most people got above A's on papers, and the mid term was easy.  Doing readings is helpful before class because you end up citing and using them in papers anyway.  Better to gradually read them instead of cramming last minute.  Overall easy A and I enjoyed the class!

There are required readings every day and the class is mostly discussion style. Even though there is a lot of reading, he grades fairly easily. He's very personable and the class room atmosphere is relaxed. His teaching style is a little disorganized but he's more than willing to go back and re-explain things.

A really funny guy. Textbook was used pretty heavily, and there's a lot of readings. He goes over most of them in class though, which is helpful. Exams were fairly easy, and he's also really lax about daily reading note assignments. I felt a little lost a couple times, but he was extremely helpful when I talked to him in his office hours.

I liked the class--it was interesting, and I thought David was both helpful and informative at the same time. He does make a lot of corny jokes at times, but I thought they fit with the topics we discussed.

AWFUL. I believe the class would have been interesting if taught by another individual. He said it was his first time teaching this course, and it was obvious; his focus is very poor, and is quick to make corny jokes. For someone who studies the English language, shouldn't you be able to spell its words as well?!
I thought David was an interesting and helpful teacher.

I liked the class, and thought David was a nice guy. Very helpful and let us turn in assignments that were late until the last week of class. Make sure to do the reading questions. b/c as I found out with my grade, he definitely counts those points.

This was an interesting class, and I appreciated the instructor's enthusiasm.  I also liked that he was open to different opinions and didn't expect all our work to just conform to what he thought was correct.  He's also very willing to answer questions.

I was really looking forward to taking a class about the "Basics of Learning a Language" but it ended up being a major disappointment. I dropped the class because the lectures were so long and boring I couldn't stand it anymore. She goes through the notes too fast but talks through the same points so slowly it's annoying. I didn't even learn much.
This was one of the best courses that I have every taken. She has incredible knowledge and a good sense of humor. I definitely recommend any course taught by Professor Hume.

hands down the worst prof and class ive taken.  the class itself was not hard at all.  the hardest thing about the class is actually going.  all the tests were online, lots of group work.  it was almost painful sometimes to stay for the whole class.  I got a good grade, but i cant say that i learned ANYTHING.

She kind of reminds me of the lady on Shining Time Station.  She's a great professor.  She really knows her stuff, and I found the material very interesting.  If you aren't a fan of language, the class would probably seem boring, but I'm a Spanish major, so it was just my style.  I highly recommend this professor if you are interested in language.

Pretty boring class- She tires to keep it interesting but after awhile the class becomes something you dread to go to- She takes attendance and talks to you like you should know everything about languages-
Well prepared lectures and activities.  Interesting class as well.

This class is really boring and she expects you to be an English major.  Very confusing and her book is very unclear.  A nice lady, but a  poor professor.  Have to go to pointless lecture because she takes attendance.  Bring a pillow.
She's cool, I liked her a lot.  She really knows her stuff, and is very helpful.
No Comments
